instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message:
Hello,
this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> was waterdamaged. Trackpad and Keyboard wont work and it did not see the battery. I followed the schematic and (it was cleaned before i got it) replaced the SMC because the ISL looks fine and the Pull ups on the dataline are good. Now it sees the battery, charges it and works without charger, but still no keyboard and Trackpad. I checked <RESISTOR>R5390</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5391</RESISTOR> ant they are fine. Without the cable connected to J4800 (must it be connected to troubleshoot this?) i checked that <SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_IF_EN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>TPAD_USB_IF_EN</SIGNAL> are not there. I am not sure if they have to be there... With an USB Keyboard it works. (As far as i know Keyboard is connected to USB internally and the external USB ports work...) I tried another Trackpad and the same. Now i am stuck.
Thanks for any help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message: Try another cable too, check connector for corrosion.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message:
Connector and cable look fine as far as i can tell but i ordered new ones to be sure. Power Button works (as expected). 
I measured the voltage on every Pin of J4800 with everything connected (unfortunately i have no good board to compare it to...):
Pin1: 3,4
Pin2: 0
Pin3: 0
Pin4: 0
Pin5: 0
Pin6: 0
Pin7: 0
Pin8: 0
Pin9: 0
Pin10: 3,3
Pin11: 3,3
Pin12: 2.8-3.3
Pin13: 2.8-3.3
Pin14: 5,13
Pin15: 0
Pin16: 3,3
Pin17: 3,3
Pin18: 3,4
Pin19: 3,4
Pin20: 3,4

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message: Wait for new cable and report back.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message:
No Title

I am still waiting for a new cable, but i tried a new housing with a new trackpad and keyboard. i attached a picture of all connectors on the trackpad and J4800. I think they all look ok. Should pin 9 of j4800 have voltage on it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message: I see corrosion on the cable, I bet that is the issue. Pin 9 is a SPI data line so it would not have a set voltage on it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message: New cable arrived today. I tried it with both my test housings (with 2 different trackpads and 2 keyboards - they both look fine but i have till now no board to verify function - ill do that as fast as possible) and the new cable still the same problem. Power button works tine but no other key or trackpad working. Any other idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message: Does the keyboard work in the boot menu, hold ALT on startup.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message: and you are right again. Keyboard and Trackpad work perfectly in bios with both cables and housings

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message: Check all SPI lines and resistors on J4800, also check <SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_IF_EN</SIGNAL> and <CHIP>U4810</CHIP> area....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message: i checked pin of 2,7,9,11,13 for continuity to the next resistor/part they lead to and everything beeps. I checked <RESISTOR>R4850</RESISTOR>-<RESISTOR>R4853</RESISTOR> and they measure all under 40 ohms. Pin 12 and 13 on j4800 have pulsing voltage on them. Between 2.6 and 3.3V. <SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_IF_EN</SIGNAL> is also pulsing between 2.8 and 3.3V. <CHIP>U4810</CHIP> looks fine to me. <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is strady at <CHIP>U4810</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message: So this is an SPI issue. The pulsing is normal if no SPI is detected. Check all pins for continuity to the connector on the trackpad.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message: i checked every Pin of j4800 and every Pin has continuity to a pin of the connector on the trackpad

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message: Only thing I can think of is do a diode mode on every pin of j4800 and compare to a good board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message: i compared it to a working one and just Pin 12 and 13 are steady 3.3V on the good one. On the non working they are both fluctuation between 2.6 and 3.3V...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message: I asked diode mode not voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message:
No Title

My bad, sorry. I did all measurements twice and i can not find any differences (picture attached) The only thing i can imagine now is bios... Because Keyboard and trackpad work both perfectly in Boot menu they have to be fine, right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message: No, in boot menu they work as a USB device and in OSX they use the SPI interface. SPI goes straight to the CPU, so this is either a dead CPU or corrosion under the connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no Trackpad and Keyboard
threads.message: Ok, thank you for the help.
